page.title: 07Local Buildings
page.content: A fortified tower added to the Church at Burgh provided shelter for the people and animals during raids by the Celts. St. Mary's Beaumont was built with stones from the Roman Wall on the site of a turret. Kingarth - a house on north bank of the Eden where Edward VII signed a fishing charter for the councillors of Carlisle. Local Wells - St. Annes, by the river and a large one (probably served the village) in the garden of Orchard House, Beaumont. Station Houses at Kirkandrews and Burgh are relics of the Carlisle to Silloth railway line. Loch House at Beaumont is on the line of the Carlisle Canal. A Monument is on the spot where Edward I died on Burgh Marsh.
